en: Give ear, O Shepherd of Israel, Thou that leadest Joseph like a flock; Thou that sittest above the cherubim, shine forth.
hmr: Aw Israelhai vêngtu, Berâm pâwl anga Josefhai ṭhuoitu, na lo sit rawh aw; Nang cherubhai chunga ṭhung chu, hung var suok rawh.

en: Before Ephraim and Benjamin and Manasseh, stir up thy might, And come to save us.
hmr: Ephraimhai le, Benjaminhai le, Manassehai mithmua chun i hrâtna kha chawktho la, Keini mi sandam dingin hung rawh.

en: Turn us again, O God; And cause thy face to shine, and we shall be saved.
hmr: Aw Pathien, mîn nghatkîrtir nâwk la; I hmêl kha sukvar la; chuong- chun, sandamin um kan tih.

en: O Jehovah God of hosts, How long wilt thou be angry against the prayer of thy people?
hmr: Aw LALPA, sipaihai Pathien, Ieng chen am i mihai ṭawngṭâina chunga hin i lunginsen ding a na?

en: Thou hast fed them with the bread of tears, And given them tears to drink in large measure.
hmr: Anni chu mitthli beiin i châwm a, Mitthli hi dâwn dingin inkhina lientakin i pêk hlak.

en: Thou makest us a strife unto our neighbors; And our enemies laugh among themselves.
hmr: Nangin kan vêla mihai ta dinga insêlnaah i mi siem hlak a, A mi dotuhai chu an innui tâwl hlak.

en: Turn us again, O God of hosts; And cause thy face to shine, and we shall be saved.
hmr: Aw sipaihai Pathien, mîn nghatkîrtir nâwk la, I hmêl kha sukvar la, chuongchun, sandamin kan um ding annâwm.

en: Thou broughtest a vine out of Egypt: Thou didst drive out the nations, and plantedst it.
hmr: Aigupta rama inthawka grêphrui i hung lâk a, Hnam tin chu i hnawt dawk a, i phun tah a;

en: Thou preparedst room before it, And it took deep root, and filled the land.
hmr: A hma i sukfai pei a, Inthûktakin zung a kei a, ram chu a aw ta vawng a.

en: The mountains were covered with the shadow of it, And the boughs thereof were like cedars of God.
hmr: Tlânghai chu a hlim tuomin an um tâwl a, A kâuhai chu Pathien sidar thinghai ang el a nih,

en: It sent out its branches unto the sea, And its shoots unto the River.
hmr: A kâuhai chu tuisuoriet chenin ân zâm suoktir a, A dâwn inderhai chu Vadungpui chenin.

en: Why hast thou broken down its walls, So that all they that pass by the way do pluck it?
hmr: Iengdinga a palhai chu i suksiet am a na? Lama fe taphawtin an kei thlâk ta hi.

en: The boar out of the wood doth ravage it, And the wild beasts of the field feed on it.
hmr: Ramhnuoia sanghal chun a suksiet a, Ram sahai khawmin an tlân hlak.

en: Turn again, we beseech thee, O God of hosts: Look down from heaven, and behold, and visit this vine,
hmr: Aw sipaihai Pathien, lungin- siettakin nghakîr nâwk ta; Vâna inthawk khan zuk en la, hi grêp hrui hi en la, hung kan rawh.

en: And the stock which thy right hand planted, And the branch that thou madest strong for thyself.
hmr: A kûng i kut changtiengin a phun le, A kâu i ta dinga i sukhrât le hin.

en: It is burned with fire, it is cut down: They perish at the rebuke of thy countenance.
hmr: Meiah a kâng tah a, phûrin a um tah a; I hmêla halna leiin an bohmang hlak.

en: Let thy hand be upon the man of thy right hand, Upon the son of man whom thou madest strong for thyself.
hmr: I kut kha i ditsak mi chungah um raw se, Mihriem naupa i ta dinga i sukhrât chunga hin.

en: So shall we not go back from thee: Quicken thou us, and we will call upon thy name.
hmr: Chuongchun, kîr san naw ning ung cheh a, Mi sukhar la; chuongchun, i hming lam kan tih.

en: Turn us again, O Jehovah God of hosts; Cause thy face to shine, and we shall be saved.
hmr: Aw LALPA, sipaihai Pathien, mîn nghatkîrtir nâwk la. I hmêl kha sukvar la, chuongchun, sandamin um kan tih.
